data.title: Ray Charles Death Tempo 1
data.meta_description:
Yes, you heard me correctly, Ray Charles Death Tempo.  I recently met a guy who plays in a band.  He invited me to come see them play at a local bar, Club Jet.  It was a good opportunity for me to try some live performance shots (which I'd never done before).  The shots weren't fantastic, but with a little more practice I'm sure I could get more keepers.
	
	And yes, I was actually lying down on the stage to get this angle.
	
	The first thing I did when post-processing this image was to rotate it counter-clockwise and crop it.  However, after finishing the post-processing, I realized I liked the original framing better.  So, I had to edit this one twice.  ;-)
	
	strobist: (2) Vivitar 285HVs, one stage left and one right, 1/2 power, 1/2 CTO gelled and shot through a SaxonPC grid (30 and 40 degree grids, I think).  Triggered via Cybersyncs.
data.text:
Yes, you heard me correctly, Ray Charles Death Tempo. I recently met a guy who plays in a band. He invited me to come see them play at a local bar, Club Jet. It was a good opportunity for me to try some live performance shots (which I'd never done before). The shots weren't fantastic, but with a little more practice I'm sure I could get more keepers.

And yes, I was actually lying down on the stage to get this angle.

The first thing I did when post-processing this image was to rotate it counter-clockwise and crop it. However, after finishing the post-processing, I realized I liked the original framing better. So, I had to edit this one twice. ;-)

strobist: (2) Vivitar 285HVs, one stage left and one right, 1/2 power, 1/2 CTO gelled and shot through a SaxonPC grid (30 and 40 degree grids, I think). Triggered via Cybersyncs.
